headline: AMD Selloff After Record Results Raises Questions On AI Growth Timing
summary: AMD shares fell around 17% after its fourth quarter and full year results, despite record revenue and earnings. The company highlighted growth in AI and data center products, along with new AI partnerships and product launches. Investor focus turned to a cautious first quarter revenue outlook and a more gradual near term view on AI related demand. For investors watching NasdaqGS:AMD, the sharp move stands out against a longer track record of strong returns, with the stock up 74.7% over the...

content.summary: AMD shares fell around 17% after its fourth quarter and full year results, despite record revenue and earnings. The company highlighted growth in AI and data center products, along with new AI partnerships and product launches. Investor focus turned to a cautious first quarter revenue outlook and a more gradual near term view on AI related demand. For investors watching NasdaqGS:AMD, the sharp move stands out against a longer track record of strong returns, with the stock up 74.7% over the...

headline: Exclusive-Intel, AMD notify customers in China of lengthy waits for CPUs
summary: Intel and AMD have notified Chinese customers of supply shortages for server central processing units (CPUs), with Intel warning of delivery lead times of up to six months, people with knowledge of the delays said.  The supply ​constraints have driven up prices for Intel's server products in China by more than 10% generally, although pricing varies by ‌customer contract, according to one of the people.  Booming investment in artificial intelligence infrastructure has created a frantic rush not only for AI-specific chips, but also other parts of ‌the supply chain - most acutely in memory chips, prices of which continue to soar.

content.title: Exclusive-Intel, AMD notify customers in China of lengthy waits for CPUs
content.summary: Intel and AMD have notified Chinese customers of supply shortages for server central processing units (CPUs), with Intel warning of delivery lead times of up to six months, people with knowledge of the delays said.  The supply ​constraints have driven up prices for Intel's server products in China by more than 10% generally, although pricing varies by ‌customer contract, according to one of the people.  Booming investment in artificial intelligence infrastructure has created a frantic rush not only for AI-specific chips, but also other parts of ‌the supply chain - most acutely in memory chips, prices of which continue to soar.

headline: The Robot Revolution Is Real. Tesla, Hyundai, and More Stocks to Play It.
summary: Once the domain of science fiction, autonomous robots—think C-3PO from Star Wars or Baymax from Big Hero 6—are getting closer by the year.  At 2025’s CES electronics conference, there were a handful of humanoids, none of which seemed to catch the world’s attention.  At January’s conference, robots, including Boston Dynamics’ Atlas, a 6-foot-2-inch automaton weighing in at just under 200 pounds with a digital smiley face, were the stars.

content.title: The Robot Revolution Is Real. Tesla, Hyundai, and More Stocks to Play It.
content.summary: Once the domain of science fiction, autonomous robots—think C-3PO from Star Wars or Baymax from Big Hero 6—are getting closer by the year.  At 2025’s CES electronics conference, there were a handful of humanoids, none of which seemed to catch the world’s attention.  At January’s conference, robots, including Boston Dynamics’ Atlas, a 6-foot-2-inch automaton weighing in at just under 200 pounds with a digital smiley face, were the stars.

headline: Why this analyst likes AMD over Nvidia: The rate of change is faster
summary: Benchmark Company managing director and senior semiconductor research analyst Cody Acre explains why he is still favoring AI chipmaker Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) over Nvidia (NVDA). Nvidia is scheduled to report earnings on February 25. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime.

headline: AI Chips Today - AGMH Advances AI Infrastructure With Strategic Chip Procurement
summary: AGMH Group Holdings Inc. has initiated a strategic procurement program aimed at enhancing its capabilities in the AI chip sector. By partnering with leading global semiconductor suppliers, AGMH is focusing on securing high-performance NAND Flash memory and controller chips to support its development of all-flash storage systems tailored for AI workloads. This initiative seeks to address the storage bottlenecks faced by data centers handling large-scale AI applications, which traditional...
